snippet: Executives made frequent trips to Washington to press their case in an antitrust inquiry, laying out legal arguments and applying lessons from Microsoft’s bruising 1990s battle.
abstract: Google executives worked behind scenes for 19 months with antitrust regulators investigating company over its search practices, making frequent trips to Washington to lay out Google's case; they ultimately convinced Federal Trade Commission that the law was on Google's side and that consumers had been largely unharmed.

byline.original: By CLAIRE CAIN MILLER and NICK WINGFIELD
byline.contributor: Claire Cain Miller reported from San Francisco, and Nick Wingfield from Seattle.

lead_paragraph: Executives made frequent trips to Washington to press their case in an antitrust inquiry, laying out legal arguments and applying lessons from Microsoft’s bruising 1990s battle.

headline.seo: Google’s Lawyers Work Behind the Scenes to Carry the Day
headline.main: Google Pushed Hard Behind the Scenes to Convince Regulators
